> 
> This just became one of my most wanted features. I didn't even know I needed it lol.

GUI's aren't my thing; but this is actually very easy to make. I wonder if there is an internal parts list already, (plenty of good reasons to keep track of what is associated with a vessel)... but running down the node chain isn't too difficult. Again, GUI's aren't my thing; but someone who is good with them could do this in an afternoon. Sorting, icons, all of that comes later and hence "not my thing", but it really isn't that hard.

My favorite long overdue feature is to let the player choose where to build his space center (a.k.a. barn with a mud strip). Want to start on top of a mountain or on an island? No problem! Or if you want an extra challenge: start a polar space center!

Just had a thought. What if this new feature is flaps for airbraking with airplanes?

Like, proper flaps. Shouldn't be too hard to code in (I imagine they'd be pretty similar to the ailerons).

(self destruct)

> +0: wow, I would never even launch, just continuously blow stuff up!

I've been entirely serious. I've had many a launch where I could see pretty early that this will go nowhere but wrong. Of course I hardly ever see it through to the end, I just revert. Having some other way to abort the mission without waiting for the debris to hit the ground seems sensible. Especially for the ironman kind of players: bad enough to write off the rocket, no need to sit and watch as it takes out the whole space center.
It's something which tells you which size the part is, in the thumbnail! I think?
I hope it's in-flight action group editing. That is certainly a feature I think is needed for completion.

What if it tells you if you've forgot solar panels/batteries/landing legs/engines/fins.

Or it's a TWR readout!

Of course I hardly ever see it through to the end, I just revert. Having some other way to abort the mission without waiting for the debris to hit the ground seems sensible. Especially for the ironman kind of players: bad enough to write off the rocket, no need to sit and watch as it takes out the whole space center.

Makes sense, and there is precedent. You can destroy any ship in flight from the Tracking Station so all ships *must* have a self-destruct sequence. Kerbfleet's, for example, is "Zero-Zero-Zero-Destruct-Zero". I have it on good authority that certain... other space programs have been trying to get rid of some errant probes for several years now, [but can't decrypt the boss's destruct code](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115759-Kerbal-Kountdown%21%21%21%21?p=1853883#post1853883). 

Of course if you're going to use this it makes sense to have a launch escape system on hotkey, and press that one *first*.
Nah they really need a Kerb spectator gallery... Go to camera feed one..... Kerbals cheering on Jeb's "Distributed Landing Sequence".
